question: How do I schedule a Christmas tree removal in my neighborhood?
ai_response:
To schedule a Christmas tree removal in your neighborhood, you need to place your holiday tree, wreath, or greenery at the front of your property on public space only. Make sure to remove all ornaments and lights and do not put the tree in a bag. The Department of Public Works (DPW) will collect these items from January 2, 2024, to March 2, 2024. If your tree is not collected during this time, you can submit a service request for a "Christmas Tree Removal-Missed." After March 2, 2024, holiday trees and greenery will be collected at your usual trash collection point.

Used request type: Christmas Tree Removal-Missed

question: What are the specific regulations for parking enforcement in residential areas?
ai_response:
The content of your answer: In Washington D.C., the Residential Parking Program (RPP) regulates parking in designated residential areas. Residents who participate in the RPP are issued zone-specific parking permits, which allow them to park on residential streets in their zone without time restrictions. Vehicles without the appropriate zone RPP sticker are limited to parking for a maximum of two hours during the program's hours of operation. Parking enforcement is typically active from 6:00 am until 9:30 pm, Monday through Friday. Please note that enforcement requests may not be fulfilled outside these hours, during weekends, or on government holidays.

Used request type: Residential Parking Permit Violation
